posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Of course, that's why i am here for ;)

Half-Orc: (STR 20  DEX 08  CON 14  INT 13  WIS 08  CHA 06)  --  Half-Orc: (STR 28  DEX 08  CON 14  INT 13  WIS 08  CHA 06)

Pre-epic feats: Weapon focus, Improved critical, Blind fight, Knockdown, Improved knockdown, Expertise, Toughness.
Post-epic feats: Epic weapon focus, Epic prowess, Armour skin, Weapon specialization, Epic weapon specialization, Terrifying rage, Great Strength I, Epic skill focus (either Intimidate OR Taunt).

Pre-epic go for (Barbarian 17/ Rogue 3), take all your Fighter levels at epics and finish as (Barbarian 20/ Rogue 4/ Fighter 6). We do this trick in order to get as-many-as-possible epic feats.There is an option to finish this build with 30 STR by going (Barbarian 17/ Rogue 5/ Fighter 8) but you will lose 1 DR (insignificant) but also your ESF (that might hurt, depends). If Improved knockdown don't work as intended, then switch those feats for Disarm/ Improved Disarm to get a possible plus to your AB when you swing your Big Axe against people with smaller weapons. And if Intimidate works fiine with your basic 33 ranks (since it is a Will save and thus difficult to make) then take the ESF in Taunt instead.

Hope i helped,

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Arelith has some very weird rules when coming to multi-classing darknight, it requires you to take three levels of the class you want one after the other so we can't spread them over for optimal use. Moreover this is a PVP build which that has to be the best at 30th level. By going all 8 Fighter levels in epics i allowed thhe build to have room for Two ESF's plus all the necessary feats (EWF, EWS, AS, EP). Finishing as a Barbarian is why this build is so strong, it allows it to maximize both Intimidate & Taunt, which is vital to the strategy i posted. Finally Rogue is late teen's because we need at least 21 ranks in Intimidate in order to be able to take the ESF in that, the 17th Barbarian level at the 20th level is for exactly that reason (Taunt) as well.

Make no mistake, this is a brutally efficient build at what it does.
